issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The result changes to as if the union didn't have count() inside. The issue can be fixed by using srcunion.value outside the subquery in count (replace count(1) with count(srcunion.value)). Otherwise, it looks like count(1) node from union-ed queries is not present in AST at all, which might cause this result.

-Interestingly, adding group by to each query in a union produces completely weird result (count(1) is 309 for each key, whereas it should be 1 and the "logical" incorrect value if internal count is lost is 500)- Nm, that groups by table column called key, which is weird but is what Hive does
fields.summary: CBO trunk merge: union11 test fails due to incorrect plan

comments.body:
Minimum query to reproduce the issue:
{noformat}
select unionsrc.key FROM (select 'tst1' as key, count(1) as value from src s1) unionsrc;
{noformat} - returns 500 rows of tst1 whereas it should return just 1.
If you add value to select list -
{noformat}
select unionsrc.key,unionsrc.value FROM (select 'tst1' as key, count(1) as value from src s1) unionsrc;
{noformat} the problem disappears.

ASTs for both queries, both before and after CBO differ only in addition of the last select expression; however, as is obvious from the below, in CBO the absence of said expression causes the count to be completely gone.
Initial AST for the 2nd query (correct result):
{noformat}
TOK_QUERY
   TOK_FROM
      TOK_SUBQUERY
         TOK_QUERY
            TOK_FROM
               TOK_TABREF
                  TOK_TABNAME
                     src
                  s1
            TOK_INSERT
               TOK_DESTINATION
                  TOK_DIR
                     TOK_TMP_FILE
               TOK_SELECT
                  TOK_SELEXPR
                     'tst1'
                     key
                  TOK_SELEXPR
                     TOK_FUNCTION
                        count
                        1
                     value
         unionsrc
   TOK_INSERT
      TOK_DESTINATION
         TOK_DIR
            TOK_TMP_FILE
      TOK_SELECT
         TOK_SELEXPR
            .
               TOK_TABLE_OR_COL
                  unionsrc
               key
         TOK_SELEXPR
            .
               TOK_TABLE_OR_COL
                  unionsrc
               value
{noformat}

Post-CBO
{noformat}
TOK_QUERY
   TOK_FROM
      TOK_SUBQUERY
         TOK_QUERY
            TOK_FROM
               TOK_SUBQUERY
                  TOK_QUERY
                     TOK_FROM
                        TOK_TABREF
                           TOK_TABNAME
                              default
                              src
                           s1
                     TOK_INSERT
                        TOK_DESTINATION
                           TOK_DIR
                              TOK_TMP_FILE
                        TOK_SELECT
                           TOK_SELEXPR
                              0
                              DUMMY
                  $hdt$_2
            TOK_INSERT
               TOK_DESTINATION
                  TOK_DIR
                     TOK_TMP_FILE
               TOK_SELECT
                  TOK_SELEXPR
                     1
                     $f0
         $hdt$_3
   TOK_INSERT
      TOK_DESTINATION
         TOK_DIR
            TOK_TMP_FILE
      TOK_SELECT
         TOK_SELEXPR
            'tst1'
            unionsrc.key
         TOK_SELEXPR
            TOK_FUNCTION
               count
               .
                  TOK_TABLE_OR_COL
                     $hdt$_3
                  $f0
            unionsrc.value
{noformat}
Note where count is... in key-only query, where this SELEXPR is gone, there's no count, so result changes.
Appears to be caused by an aggregate in Optiq plan that has neither aggregate functions nor group by expressions; needs to be fixed, it was suggested that via Optiq rule would be the best.

I added the aggregation to plan before AST transformation (the rule-based addition doesn't work because the type of the node is different when you add:
{noformat}
Cannot add expression of different type to set:
set type is RecordType() NOT NULL
expression type is RecordType(BIGINT NOT NULL $f0) NOT NULL
set is rel#50:HiveAggregateRel.HIVE.[](child=HepRelVertex#49,group={})
{noformat}

That doesn't appear to do anything (presumably because there's no select expression in projection rel to put the aggregate into).
Probably the aggregate needs to be added back to inner of the AST, or another intermediate projection needs to be added. I will continue looking tomorrow.

Here's partial fix in process... first I tried using Optiq rules but that doesn't work due to some problems with transform (described in the patch).
I added a fix to post-CBO plan processing (before AST conversion), which fixes the issue for one small query that originally had the problem (see q file), but not for the original query. I'd need to take a look at that (probably the fix needs to be in a better place, or some check mismatches), for now attaching the in-progress patch since I will be on vacation soon
[~ashutoshc] fyi

small update. judging by debug logging the fixup is simply never called even though aggregates that are lost are of the same pattern, probably need to do it separately in ASTConverter after derived table stuff, I just put it there by accident because i had some debug logging there
I will still look at this today

patch that actually works for the original complex query, but parts may still be hacky.
Also includes the Optiq rule that doesn't work. Perhaps optiq rule can be changed to match proj-agg, and replaced it with proj-intermediate proj-new agg, that way the transform call will not crap out hopefully. Maybe I'll try this tomorrow.
After we discussed, we choose to create a derived table with new proj and aggr to address it based on [~sershe]'s code
review link: https://reviews.apache.org/r/26209/
